description: From em- +â€Ž base. Compare Old French embaissier.

verbs.description: embase (third-person singular simple present embases, present participle embasing, simple past and past participle embased)

entries.meaning: (archaic, transitive) To bring down or lower in position, status, etc.; to degrade, humiliate.
(archaic, transitive) To lower the value of (a coin, commodity etc.); to debase (a coin) with alloy.
